section7.title: 7) Disclaimer of warranties and limitation of liability

section8.title: 8) Exclusion of professional services

dsaCompliance.title: DSA Compliance Policy (EU) – I.Z.I.
dsaCompliance.relationshipContent: This Policy complements and develops the Terms and Conditions and Privacy Policy of I.Z.I., which continue to apply in everything not provided herein.

section0.title: 0) Nature of service and DSA scope
section0.classificationContent: I.Z.I. is a hosting service and online platform that allows users to exchange messages and content (text, audio, image) in private chats and create personal diaries. It is not an online marketplace or search engine.
section0.coverageContent: Obligations for online platforms hosting user content apply. Enhanced obligations for VLOPs (Very Large Online Platforms) do not apply at launch. See §17 for scaling plan if threshold is reached.

section1.title: 1) Contact points and representation
section1.singleContact: Single point of contact for authorities and DSCs (EU):
section1.euRepresentativeContent: Does not apply if the controller is established in the EU. If not, it will be designated according to art. 13 DSA.

section2.title: 2) Operational definitions
section2.noticeContent: Communication identifying allegedly illegal content or Terms violating content.
section2.actionContent: Measure taken by I.Z.I. on content or account (removal, blocking, limitation, demonetization, etc.).
section2.motivationContent: Standardized communication to affected user explaining moderation decision.

subsection1.title: 3.1 Notification channel
subsection1.content: I.Z.I. enables an accessible form within the app and on the web: [iziworld.app/legal/notice]. Notification by email to dsa-legal@iziworld.app will also be accepted when the form is not reasonably accessible.

requirements.a: Exact content location (chat ID and timestamp or internal URL),
requirements.b: Description of illegality and applicable legal basis (if known),

subsection3.title: 3.3 Acknowledgment and processing
subsection3.slaResolution: Ordinary resolution SLA: ≤ 72 business hours, except complex cases.

subsection4.title: 3.4 Possible actions
subsection4.content: Content removal, upload blocking, functionality limitation, geographic restriction, temporary account suspension, preservation for authority.
subsection4.conservation: Minimum conservation of evidence and logs according to law and Privacy Policy.

subsection5.title: 3.5 Abuse prevention
subsection5.content: Manifestly unfounded or abusive notices may result in limitations for those who issue them repeatedly (§8).

section4.title: 4) Moderation decisions and "Statement of Reasons"
section4.content: Each time I.Z.I. adopts a measure affecting content or account, it will issue the affected user a standardized motivation, which will include:

requirements.a: whether the decision derives from Terms or legal illegality;
requirements.c: essential facts and, where applicable, use of automated systems;
requirements.d: scope of the measure (what, where and for how long);
requirements.e: available resources: internal complaints system (§5), ADR (§6) and competent authority.

section5.title: 5) Internal complaints system (appeals)
section5.channelContent: from the decision notice itself and in Account > Support > Claims.
section5.reviewContent: by human team different from the one that made the decision.

section6.title: 6) Alternative dispute resolution (ADR)
section6.content: I.Z.I. will recognize alternative dispute resolution bodies certified by competent authorities in the EU. The user may submit the dispute to such bodies once the internal system is exhausted. I.Z.I. will cooperate in good faith and comply with resolutions not contrary to law. While accessible certified bodies do not exist, I.Z.I. offers voluntary ODR mediation.

section7.title: 7) "Trusted Flaggers" and cooperation
section7.content: I.Z.I. will give priority treatment to notices from entities designated as trusted flaggers by national DSCs.
section7.registry: A registry of such entities and a high availability channel will be maintained.
section7.metrics: Specific metrics will be reported in the transparency report (§13).

section8.title: 8) Measures against misuse (abuse)
section8.content: Users or notifiers who repeatedly issue illegal/violating content or manifestly unfounded notices may be temporarily suspended or have their functionalities limited.
section8.period: The period and scope will be communicated in the statement of reasons.
section8.appeal: There will be a complaint route (§5).

section9.title: 9) Transparency about moderation and automation
section9.hybrid: The platform employs hybrid moderation (AI + human review) to detect nudity, violence, harassment, spam and risks.
section9.automated: Automated tools may temporarily prevent viewing or uploading pending review.
section9.humanReview: The user retains the right to human review when a decision significantly affects them.
section9.logic: The general logic of systems and their limits are publicly described in this Policy and expanded in the Privacy Policy.

section10.title: 10) Recommenders and main parameters
section10.systems: I.Z.I. uses matching and prioritization systems for:
section10.parametersContent: user-declared signals (intention, emotional tags, language, connection preference), safety and quality signals (history of positive/negative ratings, flags), and contextual signals (availability, latency).
section10.noProfilingContent: I.Z.I. will offer, at minimum, an alternative option not based on individual profiling for general matching within the EU (e.g., random order with basic safety and language compatibility filters).
section10.userControlsContent: in Settings > Experience, the user can view and modify significant parameters.

section11.title: 11) Advertising and commercial communications
section11.launch: At launch, I.Z.I. does not show third-party advertising. If advertising were introduced in the EU:
section11.ifAdvertising: If advertising were introduced in the EU:

requirements.labeling: Ads will be clearly labeled and the promoter indicated.
requirements.parameters: Main presentation parameters and how to modify them will be explained.

section11.prohibitionsContent: no targeting to minors, no use of special data categories; no dark patterns.
section11.archive: A public archive of ads served in the EU will be maintained, if applicable.

section12.title: 12) Protection of minors
section12.exclusive: Service exclusively for those over 18 years old.
section12.verification: Verification by date of birth and enhanced controls when required by law.
section12.sensitive: Sensitive content disabled by default and zero tolerance policy with child sexual exploitation, with immediate notification to competent authorities.

section13.title: 13) Annual transparency report
section13.content: I.Z.I. will publish, at least annually, a report with:

items.notices: number of notices received (by type, origin: users, trusted flaggers, authorities),
items.actions: actions taken (removals, blocks, suspensions) and average resolution times,
items.proactive: proactive measures and volume of automated vs. human decisions,
items.requests: requests and orders from authorities and their compliance,
items.changes: description of relevant changes in recommendation and moderation systems.

section13.formatContent: PDF and open dataset (CSV/JSON). Location: iziworld.app/transparency.

section14.title: 14) Publication of active recipients (MAU-EU)
section14.content: Twice a year, I.Z.I. will publish the number of average monthly active recipients of the service in the EU, along with a reproducible methodology.

section15.title: 15) Trader traceability (if applicable)
section15.content: I.Z.I. does not offer buying and selling functionalities between users. If enabled in the future, "Know Your Business Customer" will be implemented before allowing products/services to be offered, according to DSA.

section16.title: 16) Interface design and prohibition of deceptive practices
section16.content: I.Z.I. commits to avoiding deceptive design patterns that manipulate or distort user choices, especially in consent, account closure, subscription cancellation and privacy.

section17.title: 17) VLOP obligations (scaling plan)
section17.content: If I.Z.I. reached the VLOP threshold in the EU, it will activate in ≤ 4 months:

items.crisis: Crisis response when the Commission requires it.

section17.threshold: While the threshold is not reached, these obligations do not apply.

section18.title: 18) Governance, roles and internal control
section18.securityContent: according to current Technical and Organizational Measures (TLS 1.3, encryption at rest, access control, logs and DRP).

section19.title: 19) Conservation and cooperation
section19.conservation: Minimum conservation of data and evidence necessary to comply with DSA, law and defense of claims, aligned with Privacy Policy.
section19.cooperation: Diligent cooperation with authorities and DSCs.

section20.title: 20) Entry into force and modifications
section20.content: This Policy enters into force on the indicated date and may be updated. Substantial changes will be communicated in-app and/or by email, and may require express acceptance.

annexB.automation: Use of automation: yes/no and scope

annexC.title: ANNEX C – Transparency Report metrics

subsection1.title: 1.1 Purpose and scope
subsection1.content: This policy applies only to the website iziworld.app and its subdomains. It covers web navigation, forms, analytics and payments made on the web. It does not regulate the use of I.Z.I mobile apps; for that the "App Privacy Policy" applies.

subsection2.title: 1.2 Data controller
subsection2.address: Address: Camí Terminal 6A, 07009, Palma de Mallorca, Spain

subsection3.title: 1.3 How to contact us
subsection3.content: For data protection rights or inquiries: privacy@iziworld.app or the previous postal address. Response times according to applicable regulations.

subsection4.title: 1.4 Territorial scope
subsection4.content: This policy applies to users accessing the web from the EU/EEA and United Kingdom, USA, Canada, Australia and LatAm. Specific interpretation by region is detailed in the Applicable Legislation section.

subsection5.title: 1.5 Relationship with other policies
subsection5.appPolicyContent: regulates data processed within mobile apps.
subsection5.cookiePolicyContent: integrates banner and consent management on the web.
subsection5.termsContent: regulate site use and, if applicable, web purchases.
subsection5.conflict: In case of conflict between web documents, the most protective option for the user prevails.

subsection6.title: 1.6 Minimum definitions
subsection6.websiteContent: pages and services accessible under iziworld.app and subdomains.
subsection6.webUserContent: person who navigates the web or uses its forms/payments.
subsection6.cookiesContent: tracking technologies used on the web.
subsection6.providersContent: third parties providing services (e.g., Stripe, analytics).

section2.title: 2. What data do we collect on the Web?
section2.intro: By using the official I.Z.I. website (iziworld.app) we may collect the following categories of data:

content.description: When the user signs up to create or reserve an app access account:
content.name: Name, nickname or pseudonym.
content.phone: Phone number (optional, for advanced features or account recovery).
content.country: Country of residence and date of birth (to verify age of majority).

subsection2.title: 2.2 Contact data in forms
subsection2.purpose: This data is used solely to respond to the user's request.

subsection4.title: 2.4 Payment and billing data (in case of web contracting)

content.noteContent: I.Z.I. does not store complete card data.

subsection5.title: 2.5 Web analytics data
subsection5.content: Information about visits, page views, session duration, clicks and interactions. This data is collected in aggregate and anonymous form through tools like Google Analytics or Firebase Web, always with prior consent for analytics cookies.

section3.title: 3. Purpose of Processing on the Web
section3.intro: Data collected through the website iziworld.app is processed for the following legitimate purposes:

content.createAccount: Allow creation of an initial account for subsequent app access.
content.communications: Send necessary communications for account activation, reminders or pre-launch notices.

content.respond: Handle inquiries, information requests or complaints sent by the user.
content.support: Provide basic support before downloading and using the app.

content.processPayments: Process charges for premium plans or pre-launch offers.
content.manageRequests: Handle cancellation or refund requests according to applicable regulations.

content.protectIntegrity: Protect website integrity through security controls, technical logs and access monitoring.
content.detectFraud: Detect unauthorized access or fraud attempts in payments and registrations.

content.analyzeUsage: Anonymously analyze how the web is used to improve its usability, content and security.
content.evaluateCampaigns: Evaluate digital marketing campaigns and optimize user experience.

content.authorities: Handle requests from competent authorities in data protection, consumer or tax matters.
content.records: Maintain billing records according to tax regulations.

section4.title: 4. Cookies and Tracking Technologies on the Web
section4.intro: The website iziworld.app uses cookies and similar technologies to ensure basic functionality, improve user experience and, where applicable, personalize content and ads.

technical.title: Technical or necessary cookies
technical.description: Essential for basic web functionality (session management, security, language selection).
technical.consent: Do not require consent, only prior information.

personalization.title: Personalization cookies
personalization.description: Store user preferences (language, region, recurring settings).

analytics.title: Analytics cookies
analytics.description: Allow understanding how users interact with the web (visits, navigation time, errors).

advertising.title: Advertising and tracking cookies
advertising.description: Used to show ads adapted to user interests and measure campaign effectiveness.
advertising.consent: Only activated with prior, free and informed consent.

subsection2.title: 4.2 Cookie consent and management
subsection2.banner: When first accessing, the user will see a consent banner with options: "Accept all", "Reject all" and "Configure".
subsection2.granular: Consent is granular, being able to choose which categories to accept.
subsection2.withdraw: The user can withdraw or modify their consent at any time from the manager enabled on the web.

subsection3.title: 4.3 Cookie retention
subsection3.persistentContent: remain on the device for a maximum of 24 months (depending on purpose and provider).

subsection4.title: 4.4 Controllers and third parties
subsection4.content: Some cookies are our own (internal site control) and others from third parties (Google, Meta, Stripe). In all cases, data processing agreements (DPAs) are signed and standard contractual clauses (SCCs) are applied when there are international transfers.

subsection5.title: 4.5 Rejection of non-essential cookies
subsection5.content: If the user rejects analytics or advertising cookies, they will still be able to access and navigate the web, although with limited functionality in personalization and advertising.

section5.title: 5. Legal Bases for Web Processing
section5.intro: The processing of data collected on iziworld.app is based on the following legal bases, according to GDPR and other international regulations:

content.analytics: For the use of analytics, personalization and advertising cookies.
content.registration: For account registration or pre-registration, including pre-launch communications.
content.newsletters: For email use in newsletters or optional commercial communications.

content.payments: To process payments and subscriptions contracted through the web.
content.registration: To manage registration and access to a future app account.

content.authorities: To handle requests from data protection, consumer and tax authorities.
content.billing: To retain billing data for periods required by tax regulations.

content.security: To ensure technical security of the website and prevent fraud.
content.improvements: To make improvements in web functionality through aggregate and anonymous analytics.

section6.title: 6. Data Retention Periods on the Web
section6.intro: Personal data collected through the website iziworld.app will be retained only for the time necessary to fulfill the informed purposes or applicable legal obligations.

subsection1.title: 6.1 Registration and pre-registration data
subsection1.conserved: Retained until the user activates their app account or requests deletion.
subsection1.notActivated: If not activated within a maximum period of 24 months, data will be deleted or anonymized.

subsection2.title: 6.2 Contact forms
subsection2.duration: Retained for 12 months from last communication.
subsection2.early: Early deletion if requested by the user.

subsection3.title: 6.3 Billing and payment data
subsection3.duration: Retained for 5 years according to tax and accounting regulations.
subsection3.identifiers: Transaction identifiers and invoices are retained as legal proof.

subsection4.title: 6.4 Cookies and web analytics
subsection4.persistentContent: maximum 24 months, except prior consent withdrawal.
subsection4.analyticsContent: retained in aggregate and anonymized format up to 36 months.

subsection5.title: 6.5 Security data and technical logs
subsection5.content: Access and security logs (IP, errors, fraud attempts): 90 days, extendable in case of investigations.

section7.title: 7. User Rights on the Web
section7.intro: Users of iziworld.app have guaranteed rights recognized by GDPR, CCPA/CPRA, LGPD and other international privacy regulations.

subsection1.title: 7.1 Recognized rights
subsection1.accessContent: obtain confirmation about whether we process their data and access it.
subsection1.erasureContent: request deletion of their data when no longer necessary or consent is withdrawn.
subsection1.portabilityContent: receive their data in a structured format and transmit it to another controller.
subsection1.restrictionContent: request temporary restriction of data use.
subsection1.objectionContent: reject processing of their data in certain circumstances (e.g. personalized advertising).
subsection1.withdrawalContent: at any time, without affecting lawfulness of prior processing.

subsection2.title: 7.2 Exercise of rights
subsection2.contact: Users can exercise their rights free of charge by sending a request to:

requirementsList.name: Name and email linked to web use.
requirementsList.country: Country of residence (to apply legal deadlines according to local regulations).

subsection3.title: 7.3 Response times
subsection3.euUkContent: 30 days, extendable 60 days in complex cases.
subsection3.others: Other LatAm and Canada countries: equivalent deadlines according to applicable law.

subsection4.title: 7.4 Supervisory authorities
subsection4.content: If you consider that processing of your data violates applicable regulations, you can file a complaint with the supervisory authority of your country (e.g. AEPD in Spain, CNIL in France, ICO in United Kingdom, ANPD in Brazil, INAI in Mexico).

section8.title: 8. International Data Transfers on the Web
section8.intro: Use of the website iziworld.app implies that some data may be transferred outside the user's country of residence, due to technical infrastructure and providers used.

subsection1.title: 8.1 Transfers within and outside the European Economic Area (EEA)

content.description: When data is transferred from the EU/EEA to countries without adequacy decision, Standard Contractual Clauses (SCCs) approved by the European Commission are applied.
content.withinEEAContent: Additional security measures such as encryption in transit (TLS 1.3) and at rest (AES-256) are applied.

content.providers: Some providers are based in the US (e.g. Google Analytics, Stripe).
content.measures: SCCs signing and application of enhanced technical measures are ensured.

content.canada: In Canada, transfers are governed by PIPEDA and applicable provincial regulations.
content.australia: In Australia, by the Privacy Act 1988.

subsection4.title: 8.4 Latin America
subsection4.content: Countries with current data protection laws (Mexico, Argentina, Brazil, Colombia, Chile, Peru, Uruguay, Paraguay, Ecuador, Panama, Costa Rica, Dominican Republic): transfers are made according to contracts and local regulations. In countries without specific legislation (Guatemala, El Salvador, Honduras, Nicaragua, Venezuela): GDPR principles are applied as minimum standard.

content.main: In web use, the main external providers that may involve international data transfer are:
content.google: Google LLC (Google Analytics / Firebase Web) – Analytics and performance.
content.googleAds: Google LLC (Google Ads) – Advertising and tracking (only if user consents).
content.hosting: Hetzner / AWS / Firebase Hosting – Server infrastructure and hosting.

content.dpas: Data processing agreements (DPAs) signed with all providers.
content.assessments: Data Protection Impact Assessments (DPIA) in critical services.

section9.title: 9. Data Security on the Web
section9.intro: On iziworld.app adequate technical and organizational measures are applied to protect personal data processed through the website, following the principle of privacy by design and by default (art. 25 GDPR).

content.tls: TLS 1.3 in all connections between user's browser and our servers.
content.aes: AES-256 encryption at rest for databases and storage systems.
content.backups: Encrypted backups with maximum retention of 30 days.

content.mfa: Multi-factor authentication (2FA) for administrators and technical staff.
content.roles: Role management (legal, technical, support) under principle of least privilege.
content.revocation: Immediate access revocation when employment or collaboration relationship ends.

content.logs: Security logs of access and critical modifications (retention: 90 days).
content.monitoring: Active server monitoring and early anomaly detection.
content.alerts: Automatic alert systems in case of suspicious activity.

content.infrastructure: Web infrastructure hosted on encrypted VPS and ISO 27001 certified.
content.recovery: Disaster recovery plan (BCP/DRP) with service restoration in less than 24 hours.
content.redundancy: Geographic redundancy in secure data centers.

content.contracts: Data processing agreements (DPAs/SCCs) signed with all web providers (e.g. Stripe, Google, Hetzner).
content.training: Periodic staff training in privacy and security.
content.review: Quarterly review of technical and organizational measures.

subsection6.title: 9.6 Specific web limitations
subsection6.content: The website does not process sensitive data like diaries or emotions (specific to the app). The web only processes identifying, technical, navigation and payment data, under the above measures.

communityRules.title: Community Rules – I.Z.I
communityRules.intro: In I.Z.I. your diary is your intimate space. Chat is an addition to connect with other people safely and respectfully.
communityRules.purpose: For it to work, we need everyone to follow some simple rules:

rule1.title: Mutual respect
rule1.content: Talking to someone is an act of trust. Don't use insults, harassment or threats. Empathy is the foundation of this space.

rule2.title: Safe content
rule2.content: No explicit sexual messages, violence, disturbing images or illegal activities. We want a safe place.

rule3.title: Proper use of chat
rule3.content: No spam, advertising, chains or identity impersonation.

rule4.title: Privacy
rule4.content: Don't share your or others' personal data (phones, addresses, social networks). Your safety comes first.

rule5.title: Responsible use
rule5.content: Remember: I.Z.I. does not replace doctors or psychologists. The SOS Button connects to official lines, it's not a medical emergency.

consequences.title: Consequences if you don't comply
consequences.note: Sanctions never affect your diary or your fortune cookies. They only apply to chat.

warning.title: Warning
warning.content: If something doesn't fit, we warn you and the message is deleted.

temporaryBlock.title: Temporary block
temporaryBlock.content: If you repeat, you'll lose chat access for a few hours (12–24h).

sevenDaySuspension.title: 7-day suspension
sevenDaySuspension.content: For more serious cases like repeated harassment or spam.

chatExpulsion.title: Chat expulsion
chatExpulsion.content: For very serious conduct (threats, sexual or violent content, risk of harm). You'll keep your diary, but you won't be able to use chat again.

seriousExceptions.title: Serious exceptions
seriousExceptions.content: In cases of obvious crimes (e.g. child pornography, terrorist threats, serious self-harm) the complete account may be suspended and cooperation with authorities will apply according to law.

reminder.title: Your diary is untouchable.
reminder.content: Chat is an extra gift, use it with respect so it remains a safe space for everyone.
